intro: Asyneuma cichoriiforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers are typically arranged in a single head, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Asyneuma cichoriiforme is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
